name: Shawn Biddle's dotfiles
body:
### tmux, Vim and BASH configs.
My BASH/Vim/tmux configs are organized into modularized directories that make it a lot easier to find what I'm looking for.

### Installing

1. Clone the repo into your home directory
2. `git submodule init && git submodule update`
2. Run ./install (This will move any previous .dotfiles to .file.old (.bashrc -> .bashrc.old for example)
3. **Important**: Update your ~/.gitconfig otherwise you'll be committing as me. You don't want that.
4. Install the powerline font [https://powerline.readthedocs.org/en/latest/installation/linux.html#font-installation](https://powerline.readthedocs.org/en/latest/installation/linux.html#font-installation)

### Using

* For tmux it's setup to have GNU screen keybindings, that is, ctrl-a is the leader key, not ctrl-b.
* The BASH setup is as follows: aliases and functions are in `~/.bash/` and are separated by purpose into different files in `~/.bash/alias_lib/` and `~/.bash/func_lib/` respectively.
* Input mode in BASH is set to vi
* See ~/.vim/bundle/ for the Vim plugins I have installed

### More info

* Vim/screen training videos: [youtube.com/sabiddle](http://youtube.com/sabiddle)
* My website: [shawnbiddle.com](http://shawnbiddle.com)
* Questions/comments either as a Github issue on the repo or `shawncplus AT gmail.com`
